title: Bang Saphan, the Golden Land
text:
Bang Saphan, the Golden Land 30 Jul 2015 at 03:28 85 viewed 0 comments NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: PICHAYA SVASTI - + The "Travel In Bang Saphan: The Legend Of Golden Land 2015" fair is being held in front of Bang Saphan district office, Prachuap Khiri Khan until Aug 2. 
Ban Krut beach, Bang Saphan. 
The aim is to raise awareness of the history and importance of Bang Saphan as the country's major source of gold and to conserve local art and culture. Locals hope the story will be included in textbooks in the future. Apart from tourism promotion booths and the sale of prized goods from all tambons, there will be long drum, takraw and luk thung singing contests. Call Bang Saphan district office on 032-691-184 . Family rally to Ayutthaya 
On Aug 8, the "Taking Mom To Worship Buddha Statues And Sacred Objects In The City Of Five Great Kings" car rally will take place from Bangkok's Siam Niramitr, near Ratchadaphisek Road, to several temples in Ayutthaya. 
The objectives are to attract more tourists to Ayutthaya and enhance love within families in line with the province's tourism promotion plan which focuses on historical tourism here and the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT)'s "Happy Family Month" theme. 
Participants will visit Wat Yai Chaimongkol to worship the reclining Buddha and Phra Chedi Chaimongkol, the pagoda for commemorating King Naresuan the Great's victory at wars. Wat Suwandararam, which stands where the residence of King Rama I was located during the Ayutthaya Period before he became a king, is another stop. 
The group will be lunching on at boat, while being introduced to historical events on Ayutthaya. The boat will travel past Wat Phutthaisawan, Wat Chai Watthanaram and Ban Pratuchai community. 
A visit to the statue of King Taksin the Great at Wat Pichai Songkhram, where King Taksin the Great managed to get through Burmese invaders before the fall of Ayutthaya in 1767, is on the agenda along with a visit to Wat Boromwong Issarawararam, to see the statue of King Rama V. 
The trip ends with a visit to Thung Phukhao Thong field, which played an important role during the Ayutthaya Period and is the site where King Naresuan won a battle against a Burmese warrior. 
The trip is limited to 30 cars. Admission is free. Registration is required and must be done on a first-come, first-serve basis by Friday. Each team must consist of no more than four members and place a 1,000-baht deposit to prevent the no-show case. Visit www.tiewpakklang.com or call the TAT's Ayutthaya Office on 035-246-076/7 . Rubber boat rally in Phetchaburi 
On Aug 8, the Kaeng Krachan-Phetchaburi River Basin Tourism Business Society and the TAT's Phetchaburi Office will host the "7th Rubber Boat Rally To Conserve The Phetchaburi River" near Balade Walking Street at Kaeng Krachan Dam, Phetchaburi province, from 10am-10pm. 
On offer are two kinds of tour packages. The one-day package costs 600 baht per head and provides a paddle boat trip, a T-shirt, snacks and a dinner party, as well as a sapling for each visitor to plant. 
The two-day, one-night trip costs 1,299 baht per head and provides a night's accommodation at one of the eight participating resorts, breakfast, a paddle boat trip, a T-shirt, a dinner party and snacks, as well as a tree sapling. 
Visitors can stay in Phet Riverview Resort, Phet Warin Resort, Fa Sai Riverview Resort, Nana Resort, Kaeng Krachan Riverside Resort, Rub Tawan Resort, Boat House Paradise Resort and Phet Rimtharn Resort. 
At the dinner party, there will be free flow soft drinks, cultural performances and music. Winners of the rubber boat rally will receive rewards. Call 081-880-6382 or 081-981-8405 .
